hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac12}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into four equal parts. One part is shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks from zero-halves to two-halves above the number line and tick marks from zero-fourths to four-fourths below the number line. A pink point appears at one-fourth. A blue point appears at one-half. The blue point is to the right of the pink point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into eights equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks from zero-halves to two-halves above the number line and tick marks from zero-eighths to eight-eighths below the number line. A purple point appears at three-eighths. A blue point appears at one-half. The blue point is to the right of the purple point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into six equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks from zero-halves to two-halves above the number line and tick marks from zero-sixths to six-sixths below the number line. A blue and green point appears at one-half, which is the same as three-sixths. !

hints.content: $\greenD{M}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac12}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac12$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point M, two unlabeled tick marks, and an ending point at 1. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{1}{2}$? **
 
[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, a tick mark at point L, two unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/edf9842de03ce9df93814175ad56c4741e445898)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point M, two unlabeled tick marks, and an ending point at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5a738d9c6baff8baf88d6937dea68766aad46de6)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point N, four unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/43658b383f849f38419e9767ffcca20154c19fac)
